snippet: Citing low oil prices, the company tried on Tuesday to whittle away at $13.7 billion in potential fines under the Clean Water Act.
abstract: BP presents arguments for reducing $13.7 billion in potential fines as next phase begins in trial over 2010 Gulf of Mexico oil spill; contends that ecosystem has not collapsed, citing its mitigation efforts, and argues that fines should take into account company's ability to pay amid collapse in oil prices.
lead_paragraph: Citing low oil prices, the company tried on Tuesday to whittle away at $13.7 billion in potential fines under the Clean Water Act.

headline.main: BP Argues for Smaller Fines in Final Phase of Oil Spill Trial
headline.print_headline: Bp Argues for Smaller Fines in Final Phase of Oil Spill Trial
